com.github.fge.grappa.parsers

Class ListeningParser<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.grappa.parsers.BaseActions<V>
      • com.github.fge.grappa.parsers.BaseParser<V>
        • com.github.fge.grappa.parsers.ListeningParser<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the result type of the parser
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContextAware<V>

    public abstract class ListeningParser<V>
extends BaseParser<V>
    A basic parser with an attached EventBus

    Basic usage of this parser is as follows:

    • you create classes with listening methods (see below);
    • you register these classes to the parser's bus;
    • you post objects on the bus from your parser rules.

    A "listening method" is a method which obeys the following conditions:

    • it is public;
    • it accepts a single argument, which is the type of the posted event.

    Note that the return values of this method can be anything; generally, though, such methods return void. Also note that these methods will not only receive objects of the exact type they have subscribed to, but any subtype as well; a method accepting a Number, for instance, will also receive Integers and Doubles.

    An example class would be:

         public class MyListener
     {
         private String value;

         @Subscribe
         public void setValue(final String value)
         {
             this.value = value;
         }
     }

    In your parser you could then do:

         Rule myRule()
     {
         return sequence(oneOrMore('a'), postRaw(match()));
     }

    The parser class also has two other methods to post events: one taking a ValueBuilder as an argument and another taking a Var as an argument. These methods will extract the values from both of these classes and feed it to the event bus.

    For more details on how the bus work, see the documentation for this class, along with Guava's user guide article.

    See Also:
    ValueBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public final boolean register(@Nonnull
                              java.lang.Object listener)
        Register a listener to the event bus

        The canonical use of this method is to register a listener once you have created your parser, as in:

             final MyParser parser = Parboiled.createParser(MyParser.class);
     parser.register(myListener);

        It is also usable as an action; you can write rules such as:

             Rule myRule()
     {
         return sequence(other(), register(...));
     }
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        always true
        See Also:
        EventBus.register(Object)

      • unregister

        public final boolean unregister(@Nonnull
                                java.lang.Object listener)
        Unregister a listener from this parser's EventBus

        In a similar fashion as register(Object), you can use this method as an action.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove
        Returns:
        always true

      • post

        public final <T> boolean post(@Nonnull
                              ValueBuilder<T> builder)
        Post a value on the bus from a ValueBuilder

        This method will build the value, post the result on the bus and then reset the value builder.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the value type produced by the builder
        Parameters:
        builder - the value builder
        Returns:
        always true

      • post

        public final <T> boolean post(@Nonnull
                              Var<T> var)
        Post a value on the bus from a Var

        This method will get the value of the associated var and post it on the bus.

        Notes:

        • the value must not be null;
        • this method will not affect the var in any way (ie, it will leave the existing value intact etc).
        Type Parameters:
        T - value type of the var
        Parameters:
        var - the var to use
        Returns:
        always true

      • postRaw

        public final boolean postRaw(@Nonnull
                             java.lang.Object object)
        "Raw" post to the bus

        Use this method if you want to post any other object than a value wrapped in a Var or ValueBuilder.

        Parameters:
        object - the object (must not be null)
        Returns:
        always true
